1#!/usr/bin/env python 

2# -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 

3""" 

4:mod:`tnakit.db.db1`: Aero Task Team force & moment database modules 

5====================================================================== 

6 

7This module provides several classes to interface with various *point* or *0D* 

8databases. That is, each piece of data is a scalar in all of the columns. A 

9common example of this is a force & moment database, for which the module is 

10named, where there are several scalar force or moment coefficients at each 

11flight condition. 

12 

13An example of a database that does not fit into this paradigm would be a 

14surface pressure database, in which there is a vector of surface pressures for 

15each flight condition. In the terminology of these database tools, that is an 

16example of a 1D database. 

17 

18""" 

19

75# Force and moment class 

76class DBCoeff(dict): 

77 """Generic coefficient database and interpolation class 

78 

79 :Call: 

80 >>> DBc = DBCoeff(mat=None, xls=None, csv=None, **kw) 

81 :Inputs: 

82 *mat*: :class:`str` 

83 Name of Matlab file to read 

84 *xls*: :class:`str` | :class:`xlrd.book.Book` 

85 Name of spreadsheet or interface to open workbook 

86 *csv*: :class:`str` 

87 Name of CSV file to read 

88 *sheet*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

89 Name of worksheet to read if reading from spreadsheet 

90 :Outputs: 

91 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

92 Coefficient lookup database 

93 *DBc.coeffs*: :class:`list` (:class:`str` | :class:`unicode`) 

94 List of coefficients present in the database 

95 *DBc[coeff]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

96 Data for coefficient named *coeff* 

97 :Versions: 

98 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: First version 

99 """

137 # --- Read --- 

138 # Read 

139 def read_db1_DBCoeff(self, **kw): 

140 """Read scalar database data 

141 

142 :Call: 

143 >>> DBc.read_db1_DBCoeff(**kw) 

144 :Inputs: 

145 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

146 Coefficient lookup database 

147 *mat*: :class:`str` 

148 Name of Matlab file to read 

149 *xls*: :class:`str` | :class:`xlrd.book.Book` 

150 Name of spreadsheet or interface to open workbook 

151 *csv*: :class:`str` 

152 Name of CSV file to read 

153 *sheet*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

154 Name of worksheet to read if reading from spreadsheet 

155 :Versions: 

156 * 2019-02-27 ``@ddalle``: Taken from previous :func:`__init__` 

157 """ 

158 # Get possible file names 

159 mat = kw.pop("mat", None) 

160 xls = kw.pop("xls", None) 

161 csv = kw.pop("csv", None) 

162 # Check input type 

163 if mat is not None: 

164 # Read MATLAB file 

165 self.ReadMat(mat, **kw) 

166 elif xls is not None: 

167 # Read spreadsheet 

168 # Check for *sheet* keyword 

169 if "sheet" not in kw: 

170 raise ValueError( 

171 "No worksheet name given using keyword 'sheet'") 

172 # Get sheet name 

173 sheet = kw.get("sheet") 

174 # Remove from *kw* 

175 del kw["sheet"] 

176 # Read spreadsheet 

177 self.ReadXLS(xls, sheet, **kw) 

178 elif csv is not None: 

179 # Read CSV file 

180 self.ReadCSV(csv, **kw) 

181 else: 

182 # Initialize coefficient list 

183 self.coeffs = [] 

184 

185 # --- Copy --- 

186 # Copy 

187 def copy(self): 

188 """Copy a coefficient lookup database 

189 

190 :Call: 

191 >>> DBi = DBc.copy() 

192 :Inputs: 

193 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

194 Coefficient lookup database 

195 :Outputs: 

196 *DBi*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

197 Coefficient lookup database 

198 :Versions: 

199 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: First version 

200 """ 

201 # Form a new database 

202 DBi = self.__class__() 

203 # Copy relevant parts 

204 self.copy_db1_DBCoeff(DBi) 

205 # Output 

206 return DBi 

207 

208 # Copy to other databse 

209 def copy_db1_DBCoeff(self, DBi): 

210 """Copy a coefficient lookup database 

211 

212 :Call: 

213 >>> DBc.copy_db1_DBCoeff(DBi) 

214 :Inputs: 

215 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

216 Coefficient lookup database 

217 *DBi*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

218 Coefficient lookup database 

219 :Versions: 

220 * 2019-02-21 ``@ddalle``: First version 

221 """ 

222 # Copy the coefficient list 

223 DBi.coeffs = list(self.coeffs) 

224 # Loop through columns 

225 for coeff in self.coeffs: 

226 DBi[coeff] = self[coeff].copy() 

227 # Copy interpolants, break points, and other dictionaries 

228 self.copyattr(DBi, "rbfs") 

229 self.copyattr(DBi, "bkpts") 

230 # Copy evaluation attributes 

231 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_args") 

232 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_method") 

233 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_kwargs") 

234 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_arg_aliases") 

235 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_arg_converters") 

236 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_arg_defaults") 

237 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_func") 

238 self.copyattr(DBi, "eval_func_self") 

239 # Copy UQ attributes 

240 self.copyattr(DBi, "uq_keys") 

241 self.copyattr(DBi, "uq_keys_extra") 

242 self.copyattr(DBi, "uq_keys_shift") 

243 self.copyattr(DBi, "uq_funcs_extra") 

244 self.copyattr(DBi, "uq_funcs_shift") 

245 # Output 

246 return DBi 

247 

248 # Copy an attribute if present 

249 def copyattr(self, DBi, k, vdef={}): 

250 """Make a shallow copy of an attribute if present 

251 

252 :Call: 

253 >>> DBc.copyattr(DBi, k, vdef={}) 

254 :Inputs: 

255 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

256 Coefficient lookup database 

257 *DBi*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

258 Coefficient lookup database 

259 *k*: :class:`str` 

260 Name of attribute to copy 

261 *vdef*: {``{}``} | :class:`any` 

262 Default value for output attribute if *DBc.(k)* is not present 

263 :Effects: 

264 *DBi.(k)*: *vdef* | *DBc.(k)* 

265 Shallow copy of attribute from *DBc* or *vdef* if necessary 

266 :Versions: 

267 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: First version 

268 """ 

269 # Get attribute (with default) 

270 v = getattr(self, k, vdef) 

271 # Type 

272 t = v.__class__.__name__ 

273 # Check the type in order to make a copy 

274 if t == "dict": 

275 # Copy dictionary 

276 setattr(DBi, k, dict(v)) 

277 elif t == "list": 

278 # Copy list 

279 setattr(DBi, k, list(v)) 

280 elif t == "ndarray": 

281 # Copy NumPy array 

282 setattr(DBi, k, v.copy()) 

283 else: 

284 # No copy 

285 setattr(DBi, k, v) 

286 # > 

287 

288 # ============= 

289 # Eval/CALL 

290 # ============= 

291 # < 

292 # --- Evaluation --- 

293 # Evaluate interpolation 

294 def __call__(self, *a, **kw): 

295 """Generic evaluation function 

296 

297 :Call: 

298 >>> v = DBc(*a, **kw) 

299 >>> v = DBc(coeff, x0, x1, ...) 

300 >>> V = DBc(coeff, x0, X1, ...) 

301 >>> v = DBc(coeff, k0=x0, k1=x1, ...) 

302 >>> V = DBc(coeff, k0=x0, k1=X1, ...) 

303 :Inputs: 

304 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

305 Coefficient database interface 

306 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

307 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

308 *x0*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

309 Numeric value for first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

310 *x1*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

311 Numeric value for second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

312 *X1*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

313 Array of *x1* values 

314 *k0*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

315 Name of first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

316 *k1*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

317 Name of second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

318 :Outputs: 

319 *v*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

320 Function output for scalar evaluation 

321 *V*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

322 Array of function outputs 

323 :Versions: 

324 * 2019-01-07 ``@ddalle``: First version 

325 """ 

326 # --- Get coefficient name --- 

327 # Process coefficient 

328 coeff, a, kw = self._process_coeff(*a, **kw) 

329 # --- Get method --- 

330 # Attempt to get default evaluation method 

331 try: 

332 # Check for evaluation methods and "_" key is default 

333 method_def = self.eval_method["_"] 

334 except AttributeError: 

335 # No evaluation method at all 

336 raise AttributeError("Database has no evaluation methods") 

337 except KeyError: 

338 # No default 

339 method_def = "nearest" 

340 # Specific method 

341 method_coeff = self.eval_method.get(coeff, method_def) 

342 # Check for ``None``, which forbids lookup 

343 if method_coeff is None: 

344 raise ValueError("Coeff '%s' is not an evaluation coeff" % coeff) 

345 # --- Get argument list --- 

346 # Specific lookup arguments 

347 args_coeff = self.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

348 # --- Evaluation kwargs --- 

349 # Attempt to get default aliases 

350 try: 

351 # Check for attribute and "_" default 

352 kw_def = self.eval_kwargs["_"] 

353 # Use default as fallback 

354 kw_fn = self.eval_kwargs.get(coeff, kw_def) 

355 except AttributeError: 

356 # No kwargs to eval functions 

357 kw_fn = {} 

358 except KeyError: 

359 # No default 

360 kw_fn = self.eval_kwargs.get(coeff, {}) 

361 # --- Aliases --- 

362 # Attempt to get default aliases 

363 try: 

364 # Check for attribute and "_" default 

365 alias_def = self.eval_arg_aliases["_"] 

366 # Use default as fallback 

367 arg_aliases = self.eval_arg_aliases.get(coeff, alias_def) 

368 except AttributeError: 

369 # No aliases 

370 arg_aliases = {} 

371 except KeyError: 

372 # No default 

373 arg_aliases = self.eval_arg_aliases.get(coeff, {}) 

374 # Process aliases in *kw* 

375 for k in dict(kw): 

376 # Check if there's an alias for *k* 

377 if k not in arg_aliases: continue 

378 # Get alias for keyword *k* 

379 alias_k = arg_aliases[k] 

380 # Save the value under the alias as well 

381 kw[alias_k] = kw.pop(k) 

382 # --- Argument values --- 

383 # Initialize lookup point 

384 x = [] 

385 # Loop through arguments 

386 for i, k in enumerate(args_coeff): 

387 # Get value 

388 xi = self.get_arg_value(i, k, *a, **kw) 

389 # Save it 

390 x.append(np.asarray(xi)) 

391 # Normalize arguments 

392 X, dims = self.__class__.NormalizeArguments(x) 

393 # Maximum dimension 

394 nd = len(dims) 

395 # Data size 

396 nx = np.prod(dims) 

397 # --- Evaluation --- 

398 # Process the appropriate lookup function 

399 if method_coeff in ["nearest"]: 

400 # Evaluate nearest-neighbor lookup 

401 f = lambda x: self.eval_nearest(coeff, args_coeff, x, **kw_fn) 

402 elif method_coeff in ["linear", "multilinear"]: 

403 # Evaluate using multilinear interpolation 

404 f = lambda x: self.eval_multilinear( 

405 coeff, list(args_coeff), x, **kw_fn) 

406 elif method_coeff in ["linear-schedule", "multilinear-schedule"]: 

407 # Evaluate using scheduled (in 1D) multilinear interpolation 

408 f = lambda x: self.eval_multilinear_schedule( 

409 coeff, list(args_coeff), x, **kw_fn) 

410 elif method_coeff in ["rbf"]: 

411 # Evaluate global radial basis function 

412 f = lambda x: self.eval_rbf(coeff, args_coeff, x, **kw_fn) 

413 elif method_coeff in ["rbf-slice", "rbf-linear"]: 

414 # Evaluate linear interpolation of two RBFs 

415 f = lambda x: self.eval_rbf_linear(coeff, args_coeff, x, **kw_fn) 

416 elif method_coeff in ["rbf-map", "rbf-schedule"]: 

417 # Evaluate curvilinear interpolation of slice RBFs 

418 f = lambda x: self.eval_rbf_schedule(coeff, args_coeff, x, **kw_fn) 

419 elif method_coeff in ["function", "func", "fn"]: 

420 # Combine args 

421 kw_fk = dict(kw_fn, **kw) 

422 # Evaluate specific function 

423 f = lambda x: self.eval_function(coeff, args_coeff, x, **kw_fk) 

424 else: 

425 # Unknown method 

426 raise ValueError("Could not interpret evaluation method '%s'" 

427 % method_coeff) 

428 # Calls 

429 if nd == 0: 

430 # Scalar call 

431 v = f(x) 

432 # Output 

433 return v 

434 else: 

435 # Initialize output 

436 V = np.zeros(nx) 

437 # Loop through points 

438 for j in range(nx): 

439 # Construct inputs 

440 xj = [Xi[j] for Xi in X] 

441 # Call scalar function 

442 V[j] = f(xj) 

443 # Reshape 

444 V = V.reshape(dims) 

445 # Output 

446 return V 

447 

448 # --- Alternative Evaluation --- 

449 # Evaluate only exact matches 

450 def EvalExact(self, *a, **kw): 

451 """Evaluate a coefficient but only at points with exact matches 

452 

453 :Call: 

454 >>> V, I, J, X = DBc.EvalExact(*a, **kw) 

455 >>> V, I, J, X = DBc(coeff, x0, X1, ...) 

456 >>> V, I, J, X = DBc(coeff, k0=x0, k1=X1, ...) 

457 :Inputs: 

458 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

459 Coefficient database interface 

460 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

461 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

462 *x0*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

463 Numeric value for first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

464 *x1*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

465 Numeric value for second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

466 *X1*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

467 Array of *x1* values 

468 *k0*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

469 Name of first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

470 *k1*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

471 Name of second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

472 :Outputs: 

473 *V*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

474 Array of function outputs 

475 *I*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`int`] 

476 Indices of cases matching inputs (see :func:`FindMatches`) 

477 *J*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`int`] 

478 Indices of matches within input arrays 

479 *X*: :class:`tuple` (:class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`]) 

480 Values of arguments at exact matches 

481 :Versions: 

482 * 2019-03-11 ``@ddalle``: First version 

483 """ 

484 # --- Get coefficient name --- 

485 # Process coefficient name and remaining coeffs 

486 coeff, a, kw = self._process_coeff(*a, **kw) 

487 # --- Matching values 

488 # Get list of arguments for this coefficient 

489 args = self.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

490 # Possibility of fallback values 

491 arg_defaults = getattr(self, "eval_arg_defaults", {}) 

492 # Find exact matches 

493 I, J = self.FindMatches(args, *a, **kw) 

494 # Initialize values 

495 x = [] 

496 # Loop through coefficients 

497 for i, k in enumerate(args): 

498 # Get values 

499 V = self.get_all_values(k) 

500 # Check for mismatch 

501 if V is None: 

502 # Attempt to get value from inputs 

503 xi = self.get_arg_value(i, k, *a, **kw) 

504 # Check for scalar 

505 if xi is None: 

506 raise ValueError( 

507 ("Could not generate array of possible values ") + 

508 ("for argument '%s'" % k)) 

509 elif typeutils.isarray(xi): 

510 raise ValueError( 

511 ("Could not generate fixed scalar for test values ") + 

512 ("of argument '%s'" % k)) 

513 # Save the scalar value 

514 x.append(xi) 

515 else: 

516 # Save array of varying test values 

517 x.append(V[I]) 

518 # Normalize 

519 X, dims = self.__class__.NormalizeArguments(x) 

520 # --- Evaluation --- 

521 # Evaluate coefficient at matching points 

522 if coeff in self: 

523 # Use direct indexing 

524 V = self[coeff][I] 

525 else: 

526 # Use evaluator (necessary for coeffs like *CLMX*) 

527 V = self.__call__(coeff, *X, **kw) 

528 # Output 

529 return V, I, J, X 

530 

531 # Evaluate UQ from coefficient 

532 def EvalUQ(self, *a, **kw): 

533 """Evaluate specified UQ coefficients for a specified coefficient 

534 

535 This function will evaluate the UQ coefficients savd for a given 

536 nominal coefficient by referencing the appropriate subset of 

537 *DBc.eval_args* for any UQ coefficients. For example if *CN* is a 

538 function of ``"mach"``, ``"alpha"``, and ``"beta"``; and *UCN* is a 

539 function of ``"mach"`` only, this function passes only the Mach numbers 

540 to *UCN* for evaluation. 

541 

542 :Call: 

543 >>> U = DBc.EvalUQ(*a, **kw) 

544 >>> U = DBc.EvalUQ(coeff, x0, X1, ...) 

545 >>> U = DBc.EvalUQ(coeff, k0=x0, k1=x1, ...) 

546 >>> U = DBc.EvalUQ(coeff, k0=x0, k1=X1, ...) 

547 :Inputs: 

548 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

549 Coefficient database interface 

550 *DBc.uq_coeffs*: :class:`dict` (:class:`str` | :class:`list`) 

551 Dictionary of UQ coefficient names for each coefficient 

552 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

553 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

554 *x0*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

555 Numeric value for first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

556 *x1*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

557 Numeric value for second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

558 *X1*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

559 Array of *x1* values 

560 *k0*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

561 Name of first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

562 *k1*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

563 Name of second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

564 :Outputs: 

565 *U*: :class:`dict` (:class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray`) 

566 Values of relevant UQ coefficients by name 

567 :Versions: 

568 * 2019-03-07 ``@ddalle``: First version 

569 """ 

570 # --- Get coefficient name --- 

571 # Process coefficient name and remaining coeffs 

572 coeff, a, kw = self._process_coeff(*a, **kw) 

573 # --- Argument processing --- 

574 # Specific lookup arguments 

575 args_coeff = self.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

576 # Initialize lookup point 

577 x = [] 

578 # Loop through arguments 

579 for i, k in enumerate(args_coeff): 

580 # Get value 

581 xi = self.get_arg_value(i, k, *a, **kw) 

582 # Save it 

583 x.append(np.asarray(xi)) 

584 # Normalize arguments 

585 X, dims = self.__class__.NormalizeArguments(x) 

586 # Maximum dimension 

587 nd = len(dims) 

588 # --- UQ coeff --- 

589 # Dictionary of UQ coefficients 

590 uq_coeffs = getattr(self, "uq_coeffs", {}) 

591 # Coefficients for this coefficient 

592 uq_coeff = uq_coeffs.get(coeff, []) 

593 # Check for list 

594 if typeutils.isarray(uq_coeff): 

595 # Save a flag for list of coeffs 

596 qscalar = False 

597 # Pass coefficient to list 

598 uq_coeff_list = list(uq_coeff) 

599 else: 

600 # Save a flag for scalar output 

601 qscalar = True 

602 # Make a list 

603 uq_coeff_list = [uq_coeff] 

604 # --- Evaluation --- 

605 # Initialize output 

606 U = {} 

607 # Loop through UQ coeffs 

608 for uk in uq_coeff_list: 

609 # Get evaluation args 

610 args_k = self.get_eval_arg_list(uk) 

611 # Initialize inputs to *uk* 

612 UX = [] 

613 # Loop through eval args 

614 for ai in args_k: 

615 # Check for membership 

616 if ai not in args_coeff: 

617 raise ValueError( 

618 ("UQ coeff '%s' is a function of " % uk) + 

619 ("'%s', but parent coeff '%s' is not" % (ai, coeff))) 

620 # Append value 

621 UX.append(X[args_coeff.index(ai)]) 

622 # Evaluate 

623 U[uk] = self.__call__(uk, *UX, **kw) 

624 

625 # --- Output --- 

626 # Check for scalar output 

627 if qscalar: 

628 # Return first value 

629 return U[uk] 

630 else: 

631 # Return list 

632 return U

634 # Evaluate coefficient from arbitrary list of arguments 

635 def EvalFromArgList(self, coeff, args, *a, **kw): 

636 """Evaluate coefficient from arbitrary argument list 

637 

638 This function is used to evaluate a coefficient when given the 

639 arguments to some other coefficient. 

640 

641 :Call: 

642 >>> V = DBc.EvalFromArgList(coeff, args, *a, **kw) 

643 >>> V = DBc.EvalFromArgList(coeff, args, x0, X1, ...) 

644 >>> V = DBc.EvalFromArgList(coeff, args, k0=x0, k1=x1, ...) 

645 >>> V = DBc.EvalFromArgList(coeff, args, k0=x0, k1=X1, ...) 

646 :Inputs: 

647 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

648 Coefficient database interface 

649 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

650 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

651 *args*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

652 List of arguments provided 

653 *x0*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

654 Numeric value for first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

655 *x1*: :class:`float` | :class:`int` 

656 Numeric value for second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

657 *X1*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

658 Array of *x1* values 

659 *k0*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

660 Name of first argument to *coeff* evaluator 

661 *k1*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

662 Name of second argument to *coeff* evaluator 

663 :Outputs: 

664 *V*: :class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray` 

665 Values of *coeff* as appropriate 

666 :Versions: 

667 * 2019-03-13 ``@ddalle``: First version 

668 """ 

669 # --- Argument processing --- 

670 # Specific lookup arguments for *coeff* 

671 args_coeff = self.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

672 # Initialize lookup point 

673 x = [] 

674 # Loop through arguments asgiven 

675 for i, k in enumerate(args): 

676 # Get value 

677 xi = self.get_arg_value(i, k, *a, **kw) 

678 # Save it 

679 x.append(np.asarray(xi)) 

680 # Normalize arguments 

681 X, dims = self.__class__.NormalizeArguments(x) 

682 # Maximum dimension 

683 nd = len(dims) 

684 # --- Evaluation --- 

685 # Initialize inputs to *coeff* 

686 A = [] 

687 # Get aliases for this coeffiient 

688 aliases = getattr(self, "eval_arg_aliases", {}) 

689 aliases = aliases.get(coeff, {}) 

690 # Loop through eval args 

691 for ai in args_coeff: 

692 # Check for membership 

693 if ai in args: 

694 # Append value 

695 A.append(X[args.index(ai)]) 

696 continue 

697 # Check aliases 

698 for k, v in aliases.items(): 

699 # Check if we found the argument sought for 

700 if v != ai: 

701 continue 

702 # Check if this alias is in the provided list 

703 if k in args: 

704 # Replacement argument name 

705 ai = k 

706 # Check for membership (second try) 

707 if ai in args: 

708 # Append value 

709 A.append(X[args.index(ai)]) 

710 continue 

711 raise ValueError( 

712 ("Coeff '%s' is a function of " % coeff) + 

713 ("'%s', not provided in argument list" % ai)) 

714 # Evaluate 

715 return self.__call__(coeff, *A, **kw) 

716 

717 # Evaluate coefficient from arbitrary list of arguments 

718 def EvalFromIndex(self, coeff, I, **kw): 

719 """Evaluate coefficient from indices 

720 

721 This function looks up the appropriate input variables and uses them to 

722 generate inputs to the database evaluation method. 

723 

724 :Call: 

725 >>> V = DBc.EvalFromArgList(coeff, I, **kw) 

726 >>> v = DBc.EvalFromArgList(coeff, i, **kw) 

727 :Inputs: 

728 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

729 Coefficient database interface 

730 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

731 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

732 *I*: :class:`np.ndarray` 

733 Indices at which to evaluation function 

734 *i*: :class:`int` 

735 Single index at which to evaluate 

736 :Outputs: 

737 *V*: :class:`np.ndarray` 

738 Values of *coeff* as appropriate 

739 *v*: :class:`float` 

740 Scalar evaluation of *coeff* 

741 :Versions: 

742 * 2019-03-13 ``@ddalle``: First version 

743 """ 

744 # --- Argument processing --- 

745 # Specific lookup arguments for *coeff* 

746 args_coeff = self.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

747 # --- Evaluation --- 

748 # Initialize inputs to *coeff* 

749 A = [] 

750 # Loop through eval args 

751 for ai in args_coeff: 

752 # Append value 

753 A.append(self.GetXValues(ai, I, **kw)) 

754 # Evaluate 

755 return self.__call__(coeff, *A, **kw) 

756 

757 # --- Attributes --- 

758 # Get argument list 

759 def get_eval_arg_list(self, coeff): 

760 """Get list of evaluation arguments 

761 

762 :Call: 

763 >>> args = DBc.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

764 :Inputs: 

765 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

766 Coefficient database interface 

767 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

768 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

769 :Outputs: 

770 *args*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

771 List of parameters used to evaluate *coeff* 

772 :Versions: 

773 * 2019-03-11 ``@ddalle``: Forked from :func:`__call__` 

774 """ 

775 # Attempt to get default 

776 try: 

777 # Check for attribute and "_" default 

778 args_def = self.eval_args["_"] 

779 except AttributeError: 

780 # No argument lists at all 

781 raise AttributeError("Database has no evaluation argument lists") 

782 except KeyError: 

783 # No default 

784 args_def = None 

785 # Specific lookup arguments 

786 args_coeff = self.eval_args.get(coeff, args_def) 

787 # Check for ``None``, which forbids lookup 

788 if args_coeff is None: 

789 raise ValueError("Coeff '%s' is not an evaluation coeff" % coeff) 

790 # Output a copy 

791 return list(args_coeff)

793 # Get evaluation method 

794 def get_eval_method(self, coeff): 

795 """Get evaluation method (if any) for a coefficient 

796 

797 :Call: 

798 >>> meth = DBc.get_eval_method(coeff) 

799 :Inputs: 

800 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

801 Coefficient database interface 

802 *coeff*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

803 Name of coefficient to evaluate 

804 :Outputs: 

805 *meth*: ``None`` | :class:`str` 

806 Name of evaluation method, if any 

807 :Versions: 

808 * 2019-03-13 ``@ddalle``: First version 

809 """ 

810 # Get attribute 

811 try: 

812 # Get dictionary 

813 eval_methods = self.eval_method 

814 except AttributeError: 

815 # Set default 

816 self.eval_method = {} 

817 # Default value 

818 eval_methods = self.eval_method 

819 # Get method 

820 return eval_methods.get(coeff)

822 # Get evaluation argument converter 

823 def get_eval_arg_converter(self, k): 

824 """Get evaluation argument converter 

825 

826 :Call: 

827 >>> f = DBc.get_eval_arg_converter(k) 

828 :Inputs: 

829 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

830 Coefficient database interface 

831 *k*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

832 Name of argument 

833 :Outputs: 

834 *f*: ``None`` | :class:`function` 

835 Callable converter 

836 :Versions: 

837 * 2019-03-13 ``@ddalle``: First version 

838 """ 

839 # Get converter dictionary 

840 try: 

841 # Get dictionary of converters 

842 converters = self.eval_arg_converters 

843 except AttributeError: 

844 # Default values 

845 converters = {} 

846 # Save 

847 self.eval_arg_converters = {} 

848 # Get converter 

849 f = converters.get(k) 

850 # Output if None 

851 if f is None: return f 

852 # Check class 

853 if not hasattr(f, "__call__"): 

854 raise TypeError("Converter for '%s' is not callable" % k) 

855 # Output 

856 return f

890 # --- Arguments --- 

891 # Process coefficient name 

892 def _process_coeff(self, *a, **kw): 

893 """Process coefficient name from arbitrary inputs 

894 

895 :Call: 

896 >>> coeff, a, kw = DBc._process_coeff(*a, **kw) 

897 >>> coeff, a, kw = DBc._process_coeff(coeff, *a, **kw) 

898 >>> coeff, a, kw = DBc._process_coeff(*a, coeff=c, **kw) 

899 :Inputs: 

900 *coeff*: :class:`str` 

901 Name of input coefficient 

902 *a*: :class:`tuple` 

903 Other sequential inputs 

904 *kw*: :class:`dict` 

905 Other keyword inputs 

906 :Outputs: 

907 *coeff*: :class:`str` 

908 Coefficient name processed from either args or kwargs 

909 *a*: :class:`tuple` 

910 Remaining inputs with coefficient name removed 

911 *kw*: :class:`dict` 

912 Keyword inputs with coefficient name removed 

913 :Versions: 

914 * 2019-03-12 ``@ddalle``: First version 

915 """ 

916 # Check for keyword 

917 coeff = kw.pop("coeff", None) 

918 # Check for string 

919 if typeutils.isstr(coeff): 

920 # Output 

921 return coeff, a, kw 

922 # Number of direct inputs 

923 na = len(a) 

924 # Process *coeff* from *a* if possible 

925 if na > 0: 

926 # First argument is coefficient 

927 coeff = a[0] 

928 # Check for string 

929 if typeutils.isstr(coeff): 

930 # Remove first entry 

931 a = a[1:] 

932 # Output 

933 return coeff, a, kw 

934 # Must be string-like 

935 raise TypeError("Coefficient must be a string") 

936 

937 # Get argument value 

938 def get_arg_value(self, i, k, *a, **kw): 

939 """Get the value of the *i*\ th argument to a function 

940 

941 :Call: 

942 >>> v = DBc.get_arg_value(i, k, *a, **kw) 

943 :Inputs: 

944 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

945 Coefficient database interface 

946 *i*: :class:`int` 

947 Argument index within *DBc.eval_args* 

948 *k*: :class:`str` 

949 Name of evaluation argument 

950 *a*: :class:`tuple` 

951 Arguments provided by :func:`__call__` 

952 *kw*: :class:`dict` 

953 Keyword arguments provided by :func:`__call__` 

954 :Outputs: 

955 *v*: :class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray` 

956 Value of the argument, possibly converted 

957 :Versions: 

958 * 2019-02-28 ``@ddalle``: First version 

959 """ 

960 # Number of direct arguments 

961 na = len(a) 

962 # Converters 

963 arg_converters = getattr(self, "eval_arg_converters", {}) 

964 arg_defaults = getattr(self, "eval_arg_defaults", {}) 

965 # Check for sufficient non-keyword inputs 

966 if na > i: 

967 # Directly specified 

968 xi = kw.get(k, a[i]) 

969 else: 

970 # Get from keywords 

971 xi = kw.get(k) 

972 # In most cases, this is sufficient 

973 if xi is not None: 

974 return xi 

975 # Check for a converter 

976 fk = arg_converters.get(k) 

977 # Apply converter 

978 if fk: 

979 # Apply converters 

980 try: 

981 # Convert values 

982 try: 

983 # Use args and kwargs 

984 xi = fk(*x, **kw) 

985 except Exception: 

986 # Use just kwargs 

987 xi = fk(**kw) 

988 # Save it 

989 if xi is not None: return xi 

990 except Exception: 

991 # Function failure 

992 print("Eval argument converter for '%s' failed") 

993 # Get default 

994 xi = arg_defaults.get(k) 

995 # Final check 

996 if xi is None: 

997 # No value determined 

998 raise ValueError( 

999 "Could not determine value for argument '%s'" % k) 

1000 else: 

1001 # Final output 

1002 return xi 

1003 

1004 # Get dictionary of argument values 

1005 def get_arg_value_dict(self, *a, **kw): 

1006 """Return a dictionary of normalized argument variables 

1007 

1008 Specifically, he dictionary contains a key for every argument used to 

1009 evaluate the coefficient that is either the first argument or uses the 

1010 keyword argument *coeff*. 

1011 

1012 :Call: 

1013 >>> X = DBc.get_arg_value_dict(*a, **kw) 

1014 >>> X = DBc.get_arg_value_dict(coeff, x1, x2, ..., k3=x3) 

1015 :Inputs: 

1016 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

1017 Coefficient database interface 

1018 *coeff*: :class:`str` 

1019 Name of coefficient 

1020 *x1*: :class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray` 

1021 Value(s) of first argument 

1022 *x2*: :class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray` 

1023 Value(s) of second argument, if applicable 

1024 *k3*: :class:`str` 

1025 Name of third argument or optional variant 

1026 *x3*: :class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray` 

1027 Value(s) of argument *k3*, if applicable 

1028 :Outputs: 

1029 *X*: :class:`dict` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

1030 Dictionary of values for each key used to evaluate *coeff* 

1031 according to *DBc.eval_args[coeff]*; each entry of *X* will 

1032 have the same size 

1033 :Versions: 

1034 * 2019-03-12 ``@ddalle``: First version 

1035 """ 

1036 # --- Get coefficient name --- 

1037 # Use normal situation 

1038 coeff, a, kw = self._process_coeff(*a, **kw) 

1039 # --- Argument processing --- 

1040 # Specific lookup arguments 

1041 args_coeff = self.get_eval_arg_list(coeff) 

1042 # Initialize lookup point 

1043 x = [] 

1044 # Loop through arguments 

1045 for i, k in enumerate(args_coeff): 

1046 # Get value 

1047 xi = self.get_arg_value(i, k, *a, **kw) 

1048 # Save it 

1049 x.append(np.asarray(xi)) 

1050 # Normalize arguments 

1051 xn, dims = self.__class__.NormalizeArguments(x) 

1052 # --- Output --- 

1053 # Initialize 

1054 X = {} 

1055 # Loop through args 

1056 for i, k in enumerate(args_coeff): 

1057 # Save value 

1058 X[k] = xn[i] 

1059 # Output 

1060 return X 

1061 

1062 

1063 # Attempt to get all values of an argument 

1064 def get_all_values(self, k): 

1065 """Attempt to get all values of a specified argument 

1066 

1067 This will use *eval_arg_converters* if possible 

1068 

1069 :Call: 

1070 >>> V = DBc.get_all_values(k) 

1071 :Inputs: 

1072 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

1073 Coefficient database interface 

1074 *k*: :class:`str` 

1075 Name of evaluation argument 

1076 :Outputs: 

1077 *V*: ``None`` | :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1078 *DBc[k]* if available, otherwise an attempt to apply 

1079 *DBc.eval_arg_converters[k]* 

1080 :Versions: 

1081 * 2019-03-11 ``@ddalle``: First version 

1082 """ 

1083 # Check if present 

1084 if k in self: 

1085 # Get values 

1086 return self[k] 

1087 # Otherwise check for evaluation argument 

1088 arg_converters = getattr(self, "eval_arg_converters", {}) 

1089 # Check if there's a converter 

1090 if k not in arg_converters: 

1091 return None 

1092 # Get converter 

1093 f = arg_converters[k] 

1094 # Attempt to apply it 

1095 try: 

1096 # Call in keyword-only mode 

1097 V = f(**self) 

1098 # Return values 

1099 return V 

1100 except Exception: 

1101 # Failed 

1102 return None 

1103 

1104 # Normalize arguments 

1105 @staticmethod 

1106 def NormalizeArguments(x, asarray=False): 

1107 """Normalized mixed float and array arguments 

1108 

1109 :Call: 

1110 >>> X, dims = DBCoeff.NormalizeArguments(x, asarray=False) 

1111 :Inputs: 

1112 *x*: :class:`list` (:class:`float` | :class:`np.ndarray`) 

1113 Values for arguments, either float or array 

1114 *asarray*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1115 Force array output 

1116 :Outputs: 

1117 *X*: :class:`list` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

1118 Normalized arrays all with same size 

1119 *dims*: :class:`tuple`\ [:class:`int`] 

1120 Original dimensions of non-scalar input array 

1121 :Versions: 

1122 * 2019-03-11 ``@ddalle``: First version 

1123 * 2019-03-14 ``@ddalle``: Added *asarray* input 

1124 """ 

1125 # Input size by argument 

1126 nxi = [xi.size for xi in x] 

1127 ndi = [xi.ndim for xi in x] 

1128 # Maximum size 

1129 nx = np.max(nxi) 

1130 nd = np.max(ndi) 

1131 # Index of maximum size 

1132 ix = nxi.index(nx) 

1133 # Corresponding shape 

1134 dims = x[ix].shape 

1135 # Check for forced array output 

1136 if asarray and (nd == 0): 

1137 # Ensure 1D output 

1138 nd = 1 

1139 dims = (1,) 

1140 # Initialize final arguments 

1141 X = [] 

1142 # Loop through arguments again 

1143 for i, xi in enumerate(x): 

1144 # Check for trivial case 

1145 if nd == 0: 

1146 # Save scalar 

1147 X.append(xi) 

1148 continue 

1149 # Get sizes 

1150 nxk = nxi[i] 

1151 ndk = ndi[i] 

1152 # Check for expansion 

1153 if ndk == 0: 

1154 # Copy size 

1155 X.append(xi*np.ones(nx)) 

1156 elif ndk != nd: 

1157 # Inconsistent size 

1158 raise ValueError( 

1159 "Cannot normalize %id and %id inputs" % (ndk, nd)) 

1160 elif nxk != nx: 

1161 # Inconsistent size 

1162 raise IndexError( 

1163 "Cannot normalize inputs with size %i and %i" % (nxk, nx)) 

1164 else: 

1165 # Already array 

1166 X.append(xi.flatten()) 

1167 # Output 

1168 return X, dims 

1169
