3053 # I/O 

3054 # =========== 

3055 # < 

3056 # --- Spreadsheets --- 

3057 # Read a spreadsheet 

3058 def ReadXLS(self, fxls, sheet, prefix=None, **kw): 

3059 """Read a simple table from one worksheet 

3060 

3061 :Call: 

3062 >>> DBc.ReadXLS(fxls, sheet, prefix=None, **kw) 

3063 >>> DBc.ReadXLS(ws, sheet, prefix=None, **kw) 

3064 :Inputs: 

3065 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

3066 Coefficient database interface 

3067 *fxls*: :class:`str` 

3068 Name of worksheet to read 

3069 *ws*: :class:`xlrd.book.Book` 

3070 Open workbook/spreadsheet interface 

3071 *sheet*: :class:`str` 

3072 Name of worksheet to read 

3073 *prefix*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

3074 Prefix to prepend to each coefficient name or dictionary of 

3075 prefixes specific to column headers 

3076 *suffix*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

3077 Prefix to append to each coefficient name or dictionary of 

3078 prefixes specific to column headers 

3079 *skiprows*: {``0``} | :class:`int` > 0 

3080 Number of rows to skip before the table 

3081 *skipcols*: {``0``} | :class:`int` > 0 

3082 Number of columns to skip before the table 

3083 *maxrows*: {``None``} | :class:`int` > 0 

3084 Maximum row to read 

3085 *maxcols*: {``None``} | :class:`int` > 0 

3086 Maximum column number to read 

3087 *translators*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

3088 Dictionary of coefficient translations, e.g. *CAF* -> *CA* 

3089 *coeffs*: {``None``} | :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

3090 Optional list of coefficients (skip others) 

3091 *subrows*: {``0``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

3092 Number of rows to skip *after* header 

3093 :Versions: 

3094 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: First version 

3095 * 2018-07-20 ``@ddalle``: Added *coeffs* 

3096 * 2018-07-24 ``@ddalle``: Added *subrows* 

3097 """ 

3098 # Get suffix 

3099 suffix = kw.get("suffix") 

3100 # Check input types 

3101 tw = fxls.__class__.__name__ 

3102 tp = prefix.__class__.__name__ 

3103 ts = suffix.__class__.__name__ 

3104 # Get workbook handle 

3105 if tw == "Book": 

3106 # Already a workbook 

3107 wb = fxls 

3108 # Save spreadsheet name 

3109 else: 

3110 # Open workbook 

3111 wb = xlrd.open_workbook(fxls) 

3112 # Save spreadsheet name 

3113 self.fxls = fxls 

3114 # Get the worksheet name 

3115 ws = wb.sheet_by_name(sheet) 

3116 # Row/column info 

3117 skiprows = kw.get("skiprows") 

3118 skipcols = kw.get("skipcols") 

3119 maxrows = kw.get("maxrows") 

3120 maxcols = kw.get("maxcols") 

3121 subrows = kw.get("subrows", 0) 

3122 # Dictionary of lookup translators 

3123 translators = kw.get("translators", {}) 

3124 # List of coefficients 

3125 coeff_list = kw.get("coeffs") 

3126 # If no explicit row skip, try to guess 

3127 if skiprows is None: 

3128 # Read first row and column 

3129 row0 = ws.row_values(0) 

3130 col0 = ws.col_values(0) 

3131 # Max dimensions 

3132 nrow = len(col0) 

3133 ncol = len(row0) 

3134 # Initialize 

3135 skiprows = 0 

3136 # Loop through rows until we find a decent candidate 

3137 for i in range(nrow): 

3138 # Read the row 

3139 rowi = ws.row_values(i) 

3140 # Filter out empty cells 

3141 V = [v for v in rowi if v != ""] 

3142 # Check 

3143 if len(V) > ncol/2: 

3144 # This is a good candidate for the header row 

3145 skiprows = i 

3146 break 

3147 # If no explicit column skip, try to guess 

3148 if skipcols is None: 

3149 # Read header row 

3150 rowi = ws.row_values(skiprows) 

3151 # Initialize 

3152 skipcols = 0 

3153 # Loop through entries to find first non-empty entry 

3154 for i in range(len(rowi)): 

3155 # Check if empty 

3156 if rowi[i] != "": 

3157 skipcols = i 

3158 break 

3159 # Read the column headers 

3160 cols = ws.row_values(skiprows, skipcols, end_colx=maxcols) 

3161 # Initialize list of coefficients 

3162 try: 

3163 self.coeffs 

3164 except AttributeError: 

3165 self.coeffs = [] 

3166 # Loop through columns 

3167 for i in range(len(cols)): 

3168 # Get column name 

3169 col = cols[i] 

3170 # Translate if necessary 

3171 col = translators.get(col, col) 

3172 # Check if this is actually a column 

3173 if not col.strip(): 

3174 continue 

3175 # Check for prefix 

3176 if tp == "dict": 

3177 # Get column prefix from dictionary 

3178 pre = prefix.get(col, prefix.get("def", "")) 

3179 elif prefix: 

3180 # Use single prefix 

3181 pre = prefix 

3182 else: 

3183 # No prefix 

3184 pre = "" 

3185 # Check for suffix 

3186 if ts == "dict": 

3187 # Get column suffix from dictionary 

3188 suf = suffix.get(col, suffix.get("def", "")) 

3189 elif suffix: 

3190 # Use single suffix 

3191 suf = suffix 

3192 else: 

3193 # No suffix 

3194 suf = "" 

3195 # Total name of coefficient 

3196 coeff = pre + col + suf 

3197 # Check if not in pre-specified list 

3198 if coeff_list and (coeff not in coeff_list): 

3199 continue 

3200 # Check for duplication 

3201 if coeff in self.coeffs: 

3202 raise ValueError( 

3203 "Coefficient '%s' is already present." % coeff) 

3204 # Read the column 

3205 V = ws.col_values( 

3206 skipcols+i, skiprows+1+subrows, 

3207 end_rowx=maxrows) 

3208 # Ensure proper interpretation 

3209 self[coeff] = np.array([v for v in V if v != ""]) 

3210 # Add to coefficient list 

3211 self.coeffs.append(coeff) 

3212 

3213 # --- CSV Files --- 

3214 # Read a CSV file 

3215 def ReadCSV(self, fcsv, prefix=None, delim=",", **kw): 

3216 """Read comma-separated value file 

3217 

3218 :Call: 

3219 >>> DBc.ReadCSV(fcsv, prefix=None, delim=",", **kw) 

3220 :Inputs: 

3221 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

3222 Coefficient database interface 

3223 *fcsv*: :class:`str` 

3224 Name of ASCII data file to read 

3225 *prefix*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

3226 Prefix to prepend to each coefficient name or dictionary of 

3227 prefixes specific to column headers 

3228 *suffix*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

3229 Prefix to append to each coefficient name or dictionary of 

3230 prefixes specific to column headers 

3231 *delim*: {``","``} | :class:`str` 

3232 Delimiter between data entries in each row 

3233 *nskip*: {``None``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

3234 Number of rows to skip 

3235 *translators*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

3236 Dictionary of coefficient translations, e.g. *CAF* -> *CA* 

3237 *txt*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

3238 Whether or not to allow text values for coefficients 

3239 :Versions: 

3240 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: First version 

3241 * 2018-07-20 ``@ddalle``: Accepting text 

3242 """ 

3243 # Get suffix 

3244 suffix = kw.get("suffix") 

3245 # Dictionary of translators 

3246 translators = kw.get("translators", {}) 

3247 # Open the file 

3248 f = open(fcsv, 'r') 

3249 # Comment character 

3250 comments = kw.get("comments", '#') 

3251 # Row skip 

3252 nskip = kw.get("nskip") 

3253 if nskip is None: 

3254 nskip = 0 

3255 # Read first line 

3256 line1 = f.readline().lstrip() 

3257 line0 = line1 

3258 # Read until line that does not start with column 

3259 while line1.startswith(comments): 

3260 # Transfer line 

3261 line0 = line1 

3262 # Skip a line 

3263 nskip += 1 

3264 # Read next line 

3265 line1 = f.readline().lstrip() 

3266 # Make sure we are skipping at least one line 

3267 if nskip == 0: nskip = 1 

3268 # Strip comments 

3269 line = line0.lstrip(comments).lstrip() 

3270 # Coefficients 

3271 cols = [col.strip() for col in line.split(delim)] 

3272 # Initialize list of coefficients 

3273 try: 

3274 self.coeffs 

3275 except AttributeError: 

3276 self.coeffs = [] 

3277 # Close the file 

3278 f.close() 

3279 # Loop through columns 

3280 for (i, col) in enumerate(cols): 

3281 # Apply translators 

3282 col = translators.get(col, col) 

3283 # Check for prefix 

3284 if isinstance(prefix, dict): 

3285 # Get column prefix from dictionary 

3286 pre = prefix.get(col, prefix.get("def", "")) 

3287 elif prefix: 

3288 # Use single prefix 

3289 pre = prefix 

3290 else: 

3291 # No prefix 

3292 pre = "" 

3293 # Check for suffix 

3294 if isinstance(suffix, dict): 

3295 # Get column suffix from dictionary 

3296 suf = suffix.get(col, suffix.get("def", "")) 

3297 elif suffix: 

3298 # Use single suffix 

3299 suf = suffix 

3300 else: 

3301 # No suffix 

3302 suf = "" 

3303 # Total name of coefficient 

3304 coeff = pre + col + suf 

3305 # Check for duplication 

3306 if coeff in self.coeffs: 

3307 raise ValueError( 

3308 "Coefficient '%s' is already present." % coeff) 

3309 # Read the column 

3310 try: 

3311 # Read as float 

3312 V = np.loadtxt(fcsv, delimiter=delim, 

3313 skiprows=nskip, comments=comments, usecols=(i,)) 

3314 except ValueError: 

3315 # Check for text 

3316 if kw.get("txt", False): 

3317 # Read as text 

3318 V = np.loadtxt(fcsv, delimiter=delim, dtype="str", 

3319 skiprows=nskip, comments=comments, usecols=(i,)) 

3320 else: 

3321 # Just skip 

3322 if kw.get("v", False): 

3323 print(" Skipping column '%s'" % col) 

3324 continue 

3325 # Save the data 

3326 self[coeff] = V 

3327 # Add to coefficient list 

3328 self.coeffs.append(coeff) 

3329 

3330 # Write a CSV file 

3331 def WriteCSV(self, fcsv, coeffs=None, fmt=None, **kw): 

3332 """Write a comma-separated file of some of the coefficients 

3333 

3334 :Call: 

3335 >>> DBc.WriteCSV(fcsv, coeffs=None, fmt=None, **kw) 

3336 :Inputs: 

3337 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

3338 Coefficient database interface 

3339 *fcsv*: :class:`str` 

3340 Name of ASCII data file to write 

3341 *coeffs*: {``None``} | :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

3342 List of coefficients to write, or write all coefficients 

3343 *fmt*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

3344 Format string to be used for each row (optional) 

3345 *fmts*: :class:`dict` | :class:`str` 

3346 Dictionary of formats to use for each *coeff* 

3347 *comments*: {``"#"``} | :class:`str` 

3348 Comment character, used as first character of file 

3349 *delim*: {``", "``} | :class:`str` 

3350 Delimiter 

3351 *translators*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

3352 Dictionary of coefficient translations, e.g. *CAF* -> *CA* 

3353 :Versions: 

3354 * 2018-06-11 ``@ddalle``: First versions 

3355 """ 

3356 # Process coefficient list 

3357 if coeffs is None: 

3358 coeffs = list(self.coeffs) 

3359 # Check for presence 

3360 for coeff in coeffs: 

3361 if coeff not in self: 

3362 raise KeyError("No output coefficient '%s'" % coeff) 

3363 # Get the count of the first key 

3364 n = len(self[coeffs[0]]) 

3365 # Loop through the keys 

3366 for i in range(len(coeffs)-1, 0, -1): 

3367 # Coefficient 

3368 coeff = coeffs[i] 

3369 # Check length 

3370 if len(self[coeff]) != n: 

3371 # Print a warning 

3372 sys.stderr.write("WARNING: skipping ") 

3373 sys.stderr.write("coefficient '%s' " % coeff) 

3374 sys.stderr.write("with mismatching length\n") 

3375 sys.stderr.flush() 

3376 # Delete it 

3377 del coeffs[i] 

3378 

3379 # Dictionary of translators 

3380 translators = kw.get("translators", {}) 

3381 # Get comment character and delimiter 

3382 cchar = kw.get("comments", "#") 

3383 delim = kw.get("delim", ", ") 

3384 

3385 # Default line format 

3386 if fmt is None: 

3387 # Set up printing format 

3388 fmts = kw.get("fmts", {}) 

3389 # Options for default print flag 

3390 prec = kw.get("prec", kw.get("precision", 6)) 

3391 emax = kw.get("emax", 4) 

3392 emin = kw.get("emin", -2) 

3393 echr = kw.get("echar", "e") 

3394 # Specific 

3395 precs = kw.get("precs", kw.get("precisions", {})) 

3396 emaxs = kw.get("emaxs", {}) 

3397 emins = kw.get("emins", {}) 

3398 # Initialize final format 

3399 fmt_list = [] 

3400 # Loop through keys to create default format 

3401 for coeff in coeffs: 

3402 # Options 

3403 kwf = { 

3404 "prec": precs.get(coeff, prec), 

3405 "emax": emaxs.get(coeff, emax), 

3406 "emin": emins.get(coeff, emin), 

3407 "echar": echr, 

3408 } 

3409 # Make a default *fmt* for this coefficient 

3410 fmti = arrayutils.get_printf_fmt(self[coeff], **kwf) 

3411 # Get format, using above default 

3412 fmti = fmts.get(coeff, fmti) 

3413 # Save to list 

3414 fmt_list.append(fmti) 

3415 # Just use the delimiter 

3416 fmt = delim.join(fmt_list) 

3417 # Apply translators to the headers 

3418 cols = [translators.get(coeff, coeff) for coeff in coeffs] 

3419 

3420 # Create the file 

3421 f = open(fcsv, 'w') 

3422 # Write header 

3423 f.write("%s " % cchar) 

3424 f.write(delim.join(cols)) 

3425 f.write("\n") 

3426 # Loop through entries 

3427 for i in range(n): 

3428 # Get values of coefficients 

3429 V = tuple(self[coeff][i] for coeff in coeffs) 

3430 # Use the format string 

3431 f.write(fmt % V) 

3432 # Newline 

3433 f.write("\n") 

3434 

3435 # Close the file 

3436 f.close() 

3437 

3438 # --- RBF CSV files --- 

3439 # Write a CSV file for radial basis functions 

3440 def WriteRBFCSV(self, fcsv, coeffs, **kw): 

3441 """Write an ASCII file of radial basis func coefficients 

3442 

3443 :Call: 

3444 >>> DBc.WriteRBFCSV(fcsv, coeffs=None, **kw) 

3445 :Inputs: 

3446 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

3447 Coefficient database interface 

3448 *fcsv*: :class:`str` 

3449 Name of ASCII data file to write 

3450 *coeffs*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

3451 List of output coefficients to write 

3452 *fmts*: :class:`dict` | :class:`str` 

3453 Dictionary of formats to use for each *coeff* 

3454 *comments*: {``"#"``} | :class:`str` 

3455 Comment character, used as first character of file 

3456 *delim*: {``", "``} | :class:`str` 

3457 Delimiter 

3458 *translators*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

3459 Dictionary of coefficient translations, e.g. 

3460 *CAF* -> *CA* 

3461 :Versions: 

3462 * 2019-07-24 ``@ddalle``: First versions 

3463 """ 

3464 # Check input type 

3465 if not isinstance(coeffs, (list, tuple)): 

3466 raise TypeError("Coefficient list must be a list of strings") 

3467 elif len(coeffs) < 1: 

3468 raise ValueError("Coefficient list must have at least one entry") 

3469 # Reference coefficient 

3470 k = coeffs[0] 

3471 # Check if present 

3472 if k not in self: 

3473 raise KeyError("No coeff '%s' in database" % k) 

3474 # Get length 

3475 n = len(self[k]) 

3476 # Check for this list of evaluation args to write 

3477 try: 

3478 # Get arg list for first *coeff* 

3479 eval_args = self.eval_args[k] 

3480 except AttributeError: 

3481 # No definitions at all 

3482 raise AttributeError( 

3483 "No 'eval_args' have been set for this database") 

3484 except KeyError: 

3485 # No eval args for this coef 

3486 raise KeyError("No 'eval_args' for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3487 # Get evaluation type 

3488 try: 

3489 # Get type 

3490 eval_meth = self.eval_method[k] 

3491 except AttributeError: 

3492 # No definitions at all 

3493 raise AttributeError( 

3494 "No 'eval_method' has been set for this database") 

3495 except KeyError: 

3496 # No eval method for reference coeff 

3497 raise KeyError("No 'eval_method' for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3498 # Check for RBFs attribute 

3499 try: 

3500 self.rbf[k] 

3501 except AttributeError: 

3502 # No definitions at all 

3503 raise AttributeError("No RBFs defined for this database") 

3504 except KeyError: 

3505 # No RBFs saved for ref coeff 

3506 raise KeyError("No RBFs for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3507 # Check if the method is in our accepted list 

3508 if eval_meth not in RBF_METHODS: 

3509 raise ValueError( 

3510 "Eval method '%s' is not consistent with RBFs" % eval_meth) 

3511 # Loop through the keys 

3512 for k in coeffs[1:]: 

3513 # Check presence of required information 

3514 if k not in self.coeffs: 

3515 raise KeyError("No coeff '%s' in database" % k) 

3516 elif k not in self.eval_args: 

3517 raise KeyError("No 'eval_args' for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3518 elif k not in self.eval_method: 

3519 raise KeyError("No 'eval_method' for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3520 elif k not in self.rbf: 

3521 raise KeyError("No RBFs for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3522 # Check length 

3523 if len(self[k]) != n: 

3524 raise ValueError( 

3525 "Coeff '%s' has length %i; expected %i" 

3526 % (k, len(self[k]), n)) 

3527 # Check values 

3528 if self.eval_args[k] != eval_args: 

3529 raise ValueError("Mismatching eval_args for coeff '%s'" % k) 

3530 elif self.eval_method[k] != eval_meth: 

3531 raise ValueError("Mismatching eval_method for coeff '%s" % k) 

3532 

3533 # Number of arguments 

3534 narg = len(eval_args) 

3535 # Get method index 

3536 imeth = RBF_METHODS.index(eval_meth) 

3537 

3538 # Dictionary of translators 

3539 translators = kw.get("translators", {}) 

3540 # Get comment character and delimiter 

3541 cchar = kw.get("comments", "#") 

3542 delim = kw.get("delim", ", ") 

3543 

3544 # Set up printing format 

3545 fmts = kw.get("fmts", {}) 

3546 # Options for default print flag 

3547 prec = kw.get("prec", kw.get("precision", 6)) 

3548 emax = kw.get("emax", 4) 

3549 emin = kw.get("emin", -2) 

3550 echr = kw.get("echar", "e") 

3551 # Specific 

3552 precs = kw.get("precs", kw.get("precisions", {})) 

3553 emaxs = kw.get("emaxs", {}) 

3554 emins = kw.get("emins", {}) 

3555 

3556 # Initialize final format 

3557 fmt_list = [] 

3558 # Initialize final column list 

3559 cols = [] 

3560 # Loop through independent variables 

3561 for k in eval_args: 

3562 # Check for alias 

3563 col = translators.get(k, k) 

3564 # Save column name 

3565 cols.append(col) 

3566 # Format options 

3567 kwf = { 

3568 "prec": precs.get(col, prec), 

3569 "emax": emaxs.get(col, emax), 

3570 "emin": emins.get(col, emin), 

3571 "echar": echr, 

3572 } 

3573 # Make a default *fmt* for this coefficient 

3574 fmti = arrayutils.get_printf_fmt(self[col], **kwf) 

3575 # Get format, using above default 

3576 fmti = fmts.get(col, fmti) 

3577 # Save to list 

3578 fmt_list.append(fmti) 

3579 

3580 # Append type 

3581 for k in ["eval_method"]: 

3582 # Check for alias 

3583 col = translators.get(k, k) 

3584 # Save column name 

3585 cols.append(col) 

3586 # Format options 

3587 kwf = { 

3588 "prec": precs.get(col, prec), 

3589 "emax": emaxs.get(col, emax), 

3590 "emin": emins.get(col, emin), 

3591 "echar": echr, 

3592 } 

3593 # Create dummy array 

3594 x = np.array([imeth]) 

3595 # Make a default *fmt* for this coefficient 

3596 fmti = arrayutils.get_printf_fmt(x, **kwf) 

3597 # Get format, using above default 

3598 fmti = fmts.get(col, fmti) 

3599 # Save to list 

3600 fmt_list.append(fmti) 

3601 

3602 # Extra columns for each output coeff 

3603 COEFF_COLS = ["", "rbf", "func", "eps", "smooth"] 

3604 # Loop through coefficients 

3605 for k in coeffs: 

3606 # Get RBF 

3607 if imeth == 0: 

3608 # Get global rbf 

3609 rbf = self.rbf[k] 

3610 # No RBF list 

3611 nrbf = 1 

3612 else: 

3613 # Get first mapped/linear rbf slice+ 

3614 rbfs = self.rbf[k] 

3615 rbf = self.rbf[k][0] 

3616 # Number of RBF slices 

3617 nrbf = len(rbfs) 

3618 # Loop through suffixes 

3619 for suf in COEFF_COLS: 

3620 # Append suffix 

3621 col = ("%s_%s" % (k, suf)).rstrip("_") 

3622 # Check for translation 

3623 col = translators.get(col, col) 

3624 # Add actual value at that point 

3625 cols.append(col) 

3626 # Get format, using above default 

3627 fmti = fmts.get(col, "%%13.6%s" % echr) 

3628 # Save to list 

3629 fmt_list.append(fmti) 

3630 

3631 # Just use the delimiter 

3632 fmt = delim.join(fmt_list) 

3633 # Number of columns 

3634 ncol = len(cols) 

3635 

3636 # Create the file 

3637 f = open(fcsv, 'w') 

3638 # Write header 

3639 f.write("%s " % cchar) 

3640 f.write(delim.join(cols)) 

3641 f.write("\n") 

3642 # Loop through RBF slices 

3643 for j in range(nrbf): 

3644 # Reference coefficient 

3645 k = coeffs[0] 

3646 # Get RBF handle 

3647 if imeth == 0: 

3648 # Global RBF 

3649 rbf = self.rbf[k] 

3650 else: 

3651 # Slice RBF 

3652 rbf = self.rbf[k][j] 

3653 # Number of points in slice 

3654 nj = rbf.nodes.size 

3655 # Initialize data array 

3656 V = np.zeros((nj, ncol)) 

3657 # Save the coefficients 

3658 if imeth == 0: 

3659 # Save all the position variables 

3660 V[:,:narg] = rbf.xi 

3661 else: 

3662 # Save the slice points 

3663 V[:,0] = self.bkpts[eval_args[0]][j] 

3664 # Save the other eval_arg values 

3665 V[:,1:narg] = rbf.xi.T 

3666 # Save the RBF type 

3667 V[:,narg] = imeth 

3668 # Loop through coefficients 

3669 for (i, k) in enumerate(coeffs): 

3670 # Get the RBF 

3671 if imeth == 0: 

3672 # Global RBF 

3673 rbf = self.rbf[k] 

3674 else: 

3675 # Slice RBF 

3676 rbf = self.rbf[k][j] 

3677 # Save values 

3678 V[:, narg + i*5 + 1] = np.asarray(rbf.di) 

3679 V[:, narg + i*5 + 2] = np.asarray(rbf.nodes) 

3680 V[:, narg + i*5 + 3] = RBF_FUNCS.index(rbf.function) 

3681 V[:, narg + i*5 + 4] = rbf.epsilon 

3682 V[:, narg + i*5 + 5] = rbf.smooth 

3683 # Write values 

3684 for i in range(nj): 

3685 # Use the format string 

3686 f.write(fmt % tuple(V[i])) 

3687 # Newline 

3688 f.write("\n") 

3689 

3690 # Close the file 

3691 f.close() 

3692 

3693 # Read RBF function 

3694 def ReadRBFCSV(self, fcsv, prefix=None, delim=",", **kw): 

3695 """Read ASCII file of radial basis function coefficients 

3696 

3697 :Call: 

3698 >>> DBc.ReadRBFCSV(fcsv, prefix=None, delimiter=",", **kw) 

3699 :Inputs: 

3700 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

3701 Coefficient database interface 

3702 *fcsv*: :class:`str` 

3703 Name of ASCII data file to read 

3704 *prefix*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

3705 Prefix to prepend to each coefficient name or dictionary of 

3706 prefixes specific to column headers 

3707 *suffix*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

3708 Prefix to append to each coefficient name or dictionary of 

3709 prefixes specific to column headers 

3710 *delim*: {``","``} | :class:`str` 

3711 Delimiter between data entries in each row 

3712 *nskip*: {``None``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

3713 Number of rows to skip 

3714 *translators*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

3715 Dictionary of coefficient translations, e.g. *CAF* -> *CA* 

3716 :Versions: 

3717 * 2019-07-24 ``@ddalle``: First version 

3718 """ 

3719 # --- Options and Column Names --- 

3720 # Get suffix 

3721 suffix = kw.get("suffix") 

3722 # Dictionary of translators 

3723 translators = kw.get("translators", {}) 

3724 # Open the file 

3725 f = open(fcsv, 'r') 

3726 # Comment character 

3727 comments = kw.get("comments", '#') 

3728 # Row skip 

3729 nskip = kw.get("nskip") 

3730 if nskip is None: 

3731 nskip = 0 

3732 # Read first line 

3733 line1 = f.readline().lstrip() 

3734 line0 = line1 

3735 # Read until line that does not start with column 

3736 while line1.startswith(comments): 

3737 # Transfer line 

3738 line0 = line1 

3739 # Skip a line 

3740 nskip += 1 

3741 # Read next line 

3742 line1 = f.readline().lstrip() 

3743 # Make sure we are skipping at least one line 

3744 if nskip == 0: 

3745 nskip = 1 

3746 # Strip comments 

3747 line = line0.lstrip(comments).lstrip() 

3748 # Coefficients 

3749 cols = [col.strip() for col in line.split(delim)] 

3750 # Initialize list of coefficients 

3751 try: 

3752 self.coeffs 

3753 except AttributeError: 

3754 self.coeffs = [] 

3755 # Close the file 

3756 f.close() 

3757 # Check for column called "eval_method" 

3758 if "eval_method" not in cols: 

3759 raise ValueError( 

3760 "File '%s' does not have column called 'eval_method'" % fcsv) 

3761 # --- Column Types --- 

3762 # Number of args 

3763 narg = cols.index("eval_method") 

3764 # Read that column 

3765 imeth = np.loadtxt(fcsv, delimiter=delim, skiprows=nskip, 

3766 comments=comments, usecols=(narg,)) 

3767 # Check for valid method 

3768 if np.any(imeth != imeth[0]): 

3769 raise ValueError("Column 'eval_method' must have uniform values") 

3770 # Get first entry 

3771 imeth = int(imeth[0]) 

3772 # Check validity 

3773 if (imeth < 0) or (imeth >= len(RBF_METHODS)): 

3774 raise ValueError("Invalid 'eval_method' %s" % imeth) 

3775 # Store first columns as evaluation args 

3776 arg_cols = cols[:narg] 

3777 # Store names of output coefficients 

3778 coeff_cols = cols[narg+1::5] 

3779 # Initialize prefixed/suffixed names 

3780 args = [] 

3781 coeffs = [] 

3782 # Read the whole file as float 

3783 V = np.loadtxt( 

3784 fcsv, delimiter=delim, 

3785 skiprows=nskip, comments=comments, ndmin=2) 

3786 

3787 # --- Save values --- 

3788 # Loop through arg columns 

3789 for (j, col) in enumerate(arg_cols + coeff_cols): 

3790 # True column number 

3791 if j < narg: 

3792 # First *narg* columns are lookup variables 

3793 i = j 

3794 else: 

3795 # After *eval_method*, 

3796 i = narg + 1 + (j-narg)*5 

3797 # Apply translators 

3798 col = translators.get(col, col) 

3799 # Check for prefix 

3800 if isinstance(prefix, dict): 

3801 # Get column prefix from dictionary 

3802 pre = prefix.get(col, prefix.get("def", "")) 

3803 elif prefix: 

3804 # Use single prefix 

3805 pre = prefix 

3806 else: 

3807 # No prefix 

3808 pre = "" 

3809 # Check for suffix 

3810 if isinstance(suffix, dict): 

3811 # Get column suffix from dictionary 

3812 suf = suffix.get(col, suffix.get("def", "")) 

3813 elif suffix: 

3814 # Use single suffix 

3815 suf = suffix 

3816 else: 

3817 # No suffix 

3818 suf = "" 

3819 # Total name of coefficient 

3820 coeff = pre + col + suf 

3821 # Save name 

3822 if j < narg: 

3823 # Save independent variable name 

3824 args.append(coeff) 

3825 else: 

3826 # Save dependent variable name 

3827 coeffs.append(coeff) 

3828 # Check for duplication 

3829 if coeff in self.coeffs: 

3830 raise ValueError( 

3831 "Coefficient '%s' is already present." % coeff) 

3832 # Save the data 

3833 self.AddCoeff(coeff, V[:,i]) 

3834 # --- Create RBFs --- 

3835 # Create evaluation methods if needed 

3836 try: 

3837 self.eval_method 

3838 except AttributeError: 

3839 self.eval_method = {} 

3840 # Create evaluation args if needed 

3841 try: 

3842 self.eval_args 

3843 except AttributeError: 

3844 self.eval_args = {} 

3845 # Create rbf handle if needed 

3846 try: 

3847 self.rbf 

3848 except AttributeError: 

3849 self.rbf = {} 

3850 # Dereference evaluation method list 

3851 eval_meth = RBF_METHODS[imeth] 

3852 # Get slice locations if appropriate 

3853 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

3854 # Create dummy inputs for blank RBF 

3855 Z = ([0.0, 1.0],) * narg 

3856 else: 

3857 # Create dummy inputs for blank RBF 

3858 Z = ([0.0, 1.0],) * (narg - 1) 

3859 # Get unique values of first *arg* 

3860 xs = np.unique(V[:, 0]) 

3861 

3862 

3863 # # Loop through coefficients 

3864 for j, coeff in enumerate(coeffs): 

3865 # Save evaluation arguments 

3866 self.eval_args[coeff] = args 

3867 # Save evaluation method 

3868 self.eval_method[coeff] = eval_meth 

3869 # Base column number 

3870 j0 = narg + 1 + j*5 

3871 # Cumulative row index 

3872 i0 = 0 

3873 # Check for slices 

3874 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

3875 # Global RBF 

3876 # Read function type 

3877 func = RBF_FUNCS[int(V[0, j0+2])] 

3878 # Create RBF 

3879 rbf = scipy.interpolate.rbf.Rbf(*Z, function=func) 

3880 # Save not-too-important actual values 

3881 rbf.di = V[:, j0] 

3882 # Use all conditions 

3883 rbf.xi = V[:,:narg].T 

3884 # Get RBF weights 

3885 rbf.nodes = V[:, j0+1] 

3886 # Get function type 

3887 rbf.function = func 

3888 # Get scale factor 

3889 rbf.epsilon = V[0, j0+3] 

3890 # Smoothing parameter 

3891 rbf.smooth = V[0, j0+4] 

3892 # Save count 

3893 rbf.N = V.shape[0] 

3894 # Save RBF 

3895 self.rbf[coeff] = rbf 

3896 # Break points for each independent variable 

3897 self.GetBreakPoints(args) 

3898 else: 

3899 # Initialize RBFs 

3900 self.rbf[coeff] = [] 

3901 # Slice RBFs 

3902 for i, xi in enumerate(xs): 

3903 # Get function type 

3904 func = RBF_FUNCS[int(V[i0, j0+2])] 

3905 # Initialize slice RBF 

3906 rbf = scipy.interpolate.rbf.Rbf(*Z, function=func) 

3907 # Number of points in this slice 

3908 ni = np.count_nonzero(V[i0:,0] == xi) 

3909 # End of range 

3910 i1 = i0 + ni 

3911 # Use subset of conditions 

3912 rbf.xi = V[i0:i1, 1:narg].T 

3913 # Save not-too-important original values 

3914 rbf.di = V[i0:i1, j0] 

3915 # Get RBF weights 

3916 rbf.nodes = V[i0:i1, j0+1] 

3917 # Get function type 

3918 rbf.function = func 

3919 # Get scale factor 

3920 rbf.epsilon = V[i0, j0+3] 

3921 # Smoothing parameter 

3922 rbf.smooth = V[i0, j0+4] 

3923 # Save count 

3924 rbf.N = ni 

3925 # Save RBF 

3926 self.rbf[coeff].append(rbf) 

3927 # Update indices 

3928 i0 = i1 

3929 # Break points for mapping variable 

3930 self.GetBreakPoints(args[0:1]) 

3931 # Get break points at each slice 

3932 self.ScheduleBreakPoints(args[1:], args[0]) 

3933 

3934 # --- Matlab Files --- 

3935 # Read a Matlab file 

3936 def ReadMat(self, fmat, **kw): 

3937 """Read a Matlab ``.mat`` file to import data 

3938 

3939 :Call: 

3940 >>> DBc.ReadMat(fmat, **kw) 

3941 :Inputs: 

3942 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

3943 Coefficient database interface 

3944 *fmat*: :class:`str` 

3945 Name of Matlab data file 

3946 :Versions: 

3947 * 2018-07-06 ``@ddalle``: First version 

3948 """ 

3949 # Initialize coefficients 

3950 try: 

3951 # Check for existing 

3952 self.coeffs 

3953 except AttributeError: 

3954 # Empty list 

3955 self.coeffs = [] 

3956 

3957 # Read the MAT file using SciPy 

3958 FM = sio.loadmat(fmat, struct_as_record=False, squeeze_me=True) 

3959 

3960 # Get primary data interface 

3961 DB = FM["DB"] 

3962 # Loop through keys 

3963 for k in DB._fieldnames: 

3964 # Save data 

3965 self[k] = getattr(DB, k) 

3966 # Append coefficient name, if necessary 

3967 if k not in self.coeffs: 

3968 self.coeffs.append(k) 

3969 

3970 # Initialize break points if needed 

3971 try: 

3972 # See if break points are present 

3973 self.bkpts 

3974 except Exception: 

3975 # Empty dictionary 

3976 self.bkpts = {} 

3977 # Check for break points 

3978 try: 

3979 # Access the break points 

3980 bkpts = FM["bkpts"] 

3981 # Loop through break points 

3982 for k in bkpts._fieldnames: 

3983 # Save to present dictionary 

3984 self.bkpts[k] = getattr(bkpts,k) 

3985 except KeyError: 

3986 # No break points 

3987 pass 

3988 

3989 # Save Matlab object 

3990 self.mat = FM 

3991 

3992 # Prepare a Matlab file output 

3993 def prepmat_db1_DBCoeff(self, **kw): 

3994 """Create a Matlab object for output 

3995 

3996 :Call: 

3997 >>> DBc.prepmat_db1_DBCoeff(**kw) 

3998 :Inputs: 

3999 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

4000 Coefficient database interface 

4001 :Outputs: 

4002 *FM*: :class:`dict` (:class:`mat_struct`) 

4003 Partially constructed Matlab output object 

4004 :Versions: 

4005 * 2019-02-27 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4006 """ 

4007 # Create a struct of variables to save 

4008 FM = kw.get("FM", {}) 

4009 # Create struct for main data 

4010 DB = siom.mat_struct() 

4011 DB._fieldnames = [] 

4012 # Loop through keys 

4013 for k in self.coeffs: 

4014 # Save the attribute 

4015 setattr(DB,k, self[k]) 

4016 # Append key 

4017 DB._fieldnames.append(k) 

4018 # Save to output dictionary 

4019 FM["DB"] = DB 

4020 # Check for break points 

4021 try: 

4022 # Call the instance to see if it exists 

4023 self.bkpts 

4024 # If so, create a struct 

4025 bkpts = siom.mat_struct() 

4026 # Loop through break point keys 

4027 for k in self.bkpts: 

4028 # Set the value to a copy of the break points 

4029 setattr(bkpts,k, self.bkpts[k]) 

4030 # Save the key names: keys -> names 

4031 bkpts._fieldnames = self.bkpts.keys() 

4032 # Save to output dictionary 

4033 FM["bkpts"] = bkpts 

4034 except AttributeError: 

4035 # That's fine; just don't write one 

4036 pass 

4037 # Output 

4038 return FM 

4039 

4040 # Prepare a Matlab file output 

4041 def PrepareMat(self, **kw): 

4042 """Create a Matlab object for output 

4043 

4044 :Call: 

4045 >>> FM = DBc.PrepareMat(**kw) 

4046 :Inputs: 

4047 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

4048 Coefficient database interface 

4049 :Outputs: 

4050 *FM*: :class:`dict` (:class:`mat_struct`) 

4051 Partially constructed Matlab output object 

4052 :Versions: 

4053 * 2018-07-06 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4054 * 2019-02-27 ``@ddalle``: Moved from :func:`WriteMat` 

4055 """ 

4056 # Create a struct of variables to save 

4057 FM = self.prepmat_db1_DBCoeff(**kw) 

4058 # Output 

4059 return FM

4077 """

4079 FM = self.PrepareMat(**kw)

4085 # Interpolation 

4086 # =============== 

4087 # < 

4088 # --- Break Points --- 

4089 # Get automatic break points 

4090 def GetBreakPoints(self, keys, nmin=5, tol=1e-12): 

4091 """Create automatic list of break points for interpolation 

4092 

4093 :Call: 

4094 >>> DBc.GetBreakPoints(key, nmin=5, tol=1e-12) 

4095 >>> DBc.GetBreakPoints(keys, nmin=5, tol=1e-12) 

4096 :Inputs: 

4097 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

4098 Coefficient database interface 

4099 *key*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

4100 Individual lookup variable 

4101 *keys*: :class:`list` (:class:`str` | :class:`unicode`) 

4102 List of lookup variables 

4103 *nmin*: {``5``} | :class:`int` > 0 

4104 Minimum number of data points at one value of a key 

4105 *tol*: {``1e-12``} | :class:`float` >= 0 

4106 Tolerance cutoff 

4107 :Outputs: 

4108 *DBc.bkpts*: :class:`dict` 

4109 Dictionary of 1D unique lookup values 

4110 *DBc.bkpts[key]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

4111 Unique values of *DBc[key]* with at least *nmin* entries 

4112 :Versions: 

4113 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4114 """ 

4115 # Check for single key list 

4116 if keys.__class__.__name__ not in ["list", "ndarray"]: 

4117 # Make list 

4118 keys = [keys] 

4119 # Initialize break points 

4120 try: 

4121 self.bkpts 

4122 except AttributeError: 

4123 self.bkpts = {} 

4124 # Loop through keys 

4125 for k in keys: 

4126 # Check if present 

4127 if k not in self.coeffs: 

4128 raise KeyError("Lookup key '%s' is not present" % k) 

4129 # Get all values 

4130 V = self[k] 

4131 # Get unique values 

4132 U = np.unique(V) 

4133 # Initialize filtered value 

4134 T = [] 

4135 # Loop through entries 

4136 for v in U: 

4137 # Check if too close to a previous entry 

4138 if T and np.min(np.abs(v-T))<=tol: 

4139 continue 

4140 # Count entries 

4141 if np.sum(np.abs(V-v)<=tol) >= nmin: 

4142 # Save the value 

4143 T.append(v) 

4144 # Save these break points 

4145 self.bkpts[k] = np.array(T) 

4146 

4147 # Map break points from other key 

4148 def MapBreakPoints(self, keys, skey): 

4149 """Create automatic list of break points for interpolation 

4150 

4151 :Call: 

4152 >>> DBc.MapBreakPoints(keys, skey) 

4153 :Inputs: 

4154 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

4155 Coefficient database interface 

4156 *key*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

4157 Individual lookup variable 

4158 *skey*: :class:`str` 

4159 Name of key to drive interpolation 

4160 :Outputs: 

4161 *DBc.bkpts*: :class:`dict` 

4162 Dictionary of 1D unique lookup values 

4163 *DBc.bkpts[key]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

4164 Unique values of *DBc[key]* with at least *nmin* entries 

4165 :Versions: 

4166 * 2018-06-29 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4167 """ 

4168 # Loop through keys 

4169 for k in keys: 

4170 # Check if present 

4171 if k not in self.coeffs: 

4172 raise KeyError("Lookup key '%s' is not present" % k) 

4173 # Initialize break points 

4174 T = [] 

4175 # Loop through slice values 

4176 for m in self.bkpts[skey]: 

4177 # Find value of slice key matching that parameter 

4178 i = np.where(self[skey] == m)[0][0] 

4179 # Output value 

4180 v = self[k][i] 

4181 # Save break point 

4182 T.append(v) 

4183 # Save break points 

4184 self.bkpts[k] = np.array(T) 

4185 

4186 # Schedule break points at slices at other key 

4187 def ScheduleBreakPoints(self, keys, skey, nmin=5, tol=1e-12): 

4188 """Create automatic list of scheduled break points for interpolation 

4189 

4190 :Call: 

4191 >>> DBc.MapBreakPoints(keys, skey) 

4192 :Inputs: 

4193 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBCoeff` 

4194 Coefficient database interface 

4195 *key*: :class:`str` | :class:`unicode` 

4196 Individual lookup variable 

4197 *skey*: :class:`str` 

4198 Name of key to drive interpolation 

4199 *nmin*: {``5``} | :class:`int` > 0 

4200 Minimum number of data points at one value of a key 

4201 *tol*: {``1e-12``} | :class:`float` >= 0 

4202 Tolerance cutoff 

4203 :Outputs: 

4204 *DBc.bkpts*: :class:`dict` 

4205 Dictionary of 1D unique lookup values 

4206 *DBc.bkpts[key]*: :class:`list` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

4207 Unique values of *DBc[key]* at each value of *skey* 

4208 :Versions: 

4209 * 2018-06-29 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4210 """ 

4211 # Loop through keys 

4212 for k in keys: 

4213 # Check if present 

4214 if k not in self.coeffs: 

4215 raise KeyError("Lookup key '%s' is not present" % k) 

4216 # Initialize scheduled break points 

4217 X = [] 

4218 # Get all values for this key 

4219 V = self[k] 

4220 # Loop through slice values 

4221 for m in self.bkpts[skey]: 

4222 # Indices of points in this slice 

4223 I = np.where(np.abs(self[skey] - m) <= tol)[0] 

4224 # Check for broken break point 

4225 if len(I) == 0: 

4226 raise ValueError("No points matching slice at " + 

4227 ("%s = %.2f" % (skey, m))) 

4228 # First value 

4229 i = I[0] 

4230 # Get unique values on the slice 

4231 U = np.unique(V[I]) 

4232 # Initialize filtered value 

4233 T = [] 

4234 # Loop through entries 

4235 for v in U: 

4236 # Check if too close to a previous entry 

4237 if T and np.min(np.abs(v-T))<=tol: 

4238 continue 

4239 # Count entries 

4240 if np.sum(np.abs(V-v)<=tol) >= nmin: 

4241 # Save the value 

4242 T.append(v) 

4243 # Save break point 

4244 X.append(np.asarray(T)) 

4245 # Save break points 

4246 self.bkpts[k] = X 

4247 

4248 

4249 # --- Key Lookup --- 

4250 # Look up a generic key 

4251 def get_key(self, k=None, defs=[], **kw): 

4252 """Process a key name, using an ordered list of defaults 

4253 

4254 :Call: 

4255 >>> ka = DBc.get_key(k=None) 

4256 :Inputs: 

4257 *DBc*: :class:`tnakit.db.db1.DBFM` 

4258 Coefficient lookup database 

4259 *k*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

4260 User-specified name of lookup key; if ``None``, automatic value 

4261 *defs*: :class:`list` 

4262 List of applicable default names for the key 

4263 *title*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

4264 Key title to use in any error messages 

4265 *error*: {``True``} | ``False`` 

4266 Whether or not to raise an exception if key is not found 

4267 :Outputs: 

4268 *ka*: *k* | *defs[0]* | *defs[1]* | ... | ``None`` 

4269 Name of lookup key in *DBc.coeffs* 

4270 :Versions: 

4271 * 2018-06-22 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4272 """ 

4273 # Get default 

4274 if (k is not None): 

4275 # Check if it's present 

4276 if k not in self.coeffs: 

4277 # Error option 

4278 if kw.get("error", True): 

4279 # Get title for error message, e.g. "angle of attack" 

4280 ttl = kw.get("title", "lookup") 

4281 # Error message 

4282 raise KeyError("No %s key found" % ttl) 

4283 else: 

4284 # If no error, return ``None`` 

4285 return defs[0] 

4286 # Otherwise, done 

4287 return k 

4288 # Loop through defaults 

4289 for ki in defs: 

4290 # Check if it's present 

4291 if ki in self.coeffs: 

4292 return ki 

4293 # If this point is reached, no default found 

4294 if not kw.get("error", True): 

4295 # No error, as specified by user 

4296 return defs[0] 

4297 # Get title for error message, e.g. "angle of attack" 

4298 ttl = kw.get("title", "lookup") 

4299 # Error message 

4300 raise KeyError("No %s key found" % ttl) 

4301 # > 

4302 

4303 # ===== 

4304 # UQ 

4305 # ===== 

4306 # < 

4307 # --- Grouping --- 

4308 # Get dictionary of test values 

4309 def _get_test_values(self, arg_list, **kw): 

4310 """Get test values for creating windows or comparing databases 

4311 

4312 :Call: 

4313 >>> vals, bkpts = DBc._get_test_values(arg_list, **kw) 

4314 :Inputs: 

4315 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4316 General coefficient database 

4317 *arg_list*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4318 List of arguments to use for windowing 

4319 :Keyword Arguments: 

4320 *test_values*: {*DBc*} | :class:`DBCoeff` | :class:`dict` 

4321 Specify values of each parameter in *arg_list* that are the 

4322 candidate points for the window; default is from *DBc* 

4323 *test_bkpts*: {*DBc.bkpts*} | :class:`dict` 

4324 Specify candidate window boundaries; must be ascending array of 

4325 unique values for each key 

4326 :Outputs: 

4327 *vals*: :class:`dict` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

4328 Dictionary of lookup values for each key in *arg_list* 

4329 *bkpts*: :class:`dict` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

4330 Dictionary of unique candidate values for each key 

4331 :Versions: 

4332 * 2019-02-13 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4333 """ 

4334 # --- Lookup values --- 

4335 # Values to use (default is direct from database) 

4336 vals = {} 

4337 # Dictionary from keyword args 

4338 test_values = kw.get("test_values", {}) 

4339 # Loop through parameters 

4340 for k in arg_list: 

4341 # Get reference values for parameter *k* 

4342 vals[k] = test_values.get(k, self[k]) 

4343 # --- Break points --- 

4344 # Values to use for searching 

4345 bkpts = {} 

4346 # Primary default: *DBc.bkpts* 

4347 self_bkpts = getattr(self, "bkpts", {}) 

4348 # Secondary default: *bkpts* attribute from secondary database 

4349 test_bkpts = test_values.get("test_bkpts", {}) 

4350 # User-specified option 

4351 test_bkpts = kw.get("test_bkpts", test_bkpts) 

4352 # Primary default: *bkpts* from this database 

4353 for k in arg_list: 

4354 # Check for specified values 

4355 if k in test_bkpts: 

4356 # Use user-specified or secondary-db values 

4357 bkpts[k] = test_bkpts[k] 

4358 elif k in self_bkpts: 

4359 # USe break points from this database 

4360 bkpts[k] = self_bkpts[k] 

4361 else: 

4362 # Use unique test values 

4363 bkpts[k] = np.unique(vals[k]) 

4364 # --- Output --- 

4365 return vals, bkpts 

4366 

4367 # Find *N* neighbors based on list of args 

4368 def _get_uq_conditions(self, arg_list, **kw): 

4369 """Get list of points at which to estimate UQ database 

4370 

4371 :Call: 

4372 >>> A = DBc.GetWindows_DB(arg_list, **kw) 

4373 >>> [[a00, a01, ...], [a10, ...]] = DBc.GetWindows_DB(...) 

4374 :Inputs: 

4375 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4376 General coefficient database 

4377 *arg_list*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4378 List of arguments to use for windowing 

4379 :Keyword Arguments: 

4380 *test_values*: {*DBc*} | :class:`DBCoeff` | :class:`dict` 

4381 Specify values of each parameter in *arg_list* that are the 

4382 candidate points for the window; default is from *DBc* 

4383 *test_bkpts*: {*DBc.bkpts*} | :class:`dict` 

4384 Specify candidate window boundaries; must be ascending array of 

4385 unique values for each key 

4386 :Outputs: 

4387 *A*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

4388 List of conditions for each window 

4389 *a00*: :class:`float` 

4390 Value of *arg_list[0]* for first window 

4391 *a01*: :class:`float` 

4392 Value of *arg_list[1]* for first window 

4393 :Versions: 

4394 * 2019-02-16 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4395 """ 

4396 # Get test values and test break points 

4397 vals, bkpts = self._get_test_values(arg_list, **kw) 

4398 # Number of args 

4399 narg = len(arg_list) 

4400 # Create tuple of all breakpoints 

4401 bkpts1d = tuple(bkpts[k] for k in arg_list) 

4402 # Create *n*-dimensional array of points (full factorial) 

4403 vals_nd = np.meshgrid(*bkpts1d, indexing="ij") 

4404 # Flatten each entry and make into a row vector 

4405 V = tuple([v.flatten()] for v in vals_nd) 

4406 # Combine into single vector 

4407 A = np.vstack(V).T 

4408 # Output 

4409 return A 

4410 

4411 # Find *N* neighbors based on list of args 

4412 def GetWindow(self, n, arg_list, *a, **kw): 

4413 """Get indices of neighboring 

4414 

4415 :Call: 

4416 >>> I = DBc.GetWindow(n, arg_list, *a, **kw) 

4417 :Inputs: 

4418 *DBc*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4419 General coefficient database 

4420 *n*: :class:`int` 

4421 Minimum number of points in window 

4422 *arg_list*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4423 List of arguments to use for windowing 

4424 *a[0]*: :class:`float` 

4425 Value of the first argument 

4426 *a[1]*: :class:`float` 

4427 Value of the second argument 

4428 :Keyword Arguments: 

4429 *test_values*: {*DBc*} | :class:`DBCoeff` | :class:`dict` 

4430 Specify values of each parameter in *arg_list* that are the 

4431 candidate points for the window; default is from *DBc* 

4432 *test_bkpts*: {*DBc.bkpts*} | :class:`dict` 

4433 Specify candidate window boundaries; must be ascending array of 

4434 unique values for each key 

4435 :Outputs: 

4436 *I*: :class:`np.ndarray` 

4437 Indices of cases (relative to *test_values*) in window 

4438 :Versions: 

4439 * 2019-02-13 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4440 """ 

4441 # --- Check bounds --- 

4442 def check_bounds(vmin, vmax, vals): 

4443 # Loop through parameters 

4444 for i,k in enumerate(arg_list): 

4445 # Get values 

4446 Vk = vals[k] 

4447 # Check bounds 

4448 J = np.logical_and(Vk>=vmin[k], Vk<=vmax[k]) 

4449 # Combine constraints if i>0 

4450 if i == 0: 

4451 # First run 

4452 I = J 

4453 else: 

4454 # Combine constraints 

4455 I = np.logical_and(I, J) 

4456 # Output 

4457 return I 

4458 # --- Init --- 

4459 # Number of args 

4460 narg = len(arg_list) 

4461 # Check inputs 

4462 if narg == 0: 

4463 # No windowing arguments 

4464 raise ValueError("At least one named argument required") 

4465 elif len(a) != narg: 

4466 # Not enough values 

4467 raise ValueError("%i argument names provided but %i values" 

4468 % (narg, len(a))) 

4469 # Get the length of the database for the first argument 

4470 nx = self[arg_list[0]].size 

4471 # Initialize mask 

4472 I = np.arange(nx) > -1 

4473 # --- Lookup values --- 

4474 # Get test values and test break points 

4475 vals, bkpts = self._get_test_values(arg_list, **kw) 

4476 # --- Tolerances/Bounds --- 

4477 # Default tolerance 

4478 tol = kw.get("tol", 1e-8) 

4479 # Tolerance dictionary 

4480 tols = {} 

4481 # Initialize bounds 

4482 vmin = {} 

4483 vmax = {} 

4484 # Loop through parameters 

4485 for i,k in enumerate(arg_list): 

4486 # Get value 

4487 v = a[i] 

4488 # Get tolerance 

4489 tolk = kw.get("%stol"%k, tol) 

4490 # Save it 

4491 tols[k] = tolk 

4492 # Bounds 

4493 vmin[k] = v - tolk 

4494 vmax[k] = v + tolk 

4495 # --- Initial Check --- 

4496 I = check_bounds(vmin, vmax, vals) 

4497 # Initial window count 

4498 m = np.count_nonzero(I) 

4499 # --- Expansion --- 

4500 # Maximum loop 

4501 maxloops = kw.get("nmax", kw.get("maxloops", 10)) 

4502 # Loop until enough points are included 

4503 for nloop in range(maxloops): 

4504 # Check count 

4505 if m >= n: 

4506 break 

4507 # Expand each argument in order 

4508 for i,k in enumerate(arg_list): 

4509 # Current bounds 

4510 ak = vmin[k] 

4511 bk = vmax[k] 

4512 # Tolerance 

4513 tolk = tols[k] 

4514 # Break points 

4515 Xk = bkpts[k] 

4516 # Look for next point outside bound 

4517 ja = Xk < ak - tolk 

4518 jb = Xk > bk + tolk 

4519 # Expand bounds if possible 

4520 if np.any(ja): vmin[k] = np.max(Xk[ja]) 

4521 if np.any(jb): vmax[k] = np.min(Xk[jb]) 

4522 # Check new window 

4523 I = check_bounds(vmin, vmax, vals) 

4524 # Update count 

4525 m = np.count_nonzero(I) 

4526 # Check count 

4527 if m >= n: 

4528 break 

4529 # --- Output --- 

4530 # Output 

4531 return np.where(I)[0] 

4532 

4533 

4534 

4535 

4536 # --- Pairwise UQ --- 

4537 # Single-point UQ estimate with indices determined 

4538 def _estimate_UQ_point(self, FM2, coeff, ucoeff, I, **kw): 

4539 """Quantify uncertainty interval for a single point or window 

4540 

4541 :Call: 

4542 >>> u, = FM1._estimateUQ_point(FM2, coeff, ucoeff, I, **kw) 

4543 >>> U = FM1._estimateUQ_point(FM2, coeff, ucoeff, I, **kw) 

4544 :Inputs: 

4545 *FM1*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4546 Original coefficient database 

4547 *FM2*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4548 Comparison coefficient database 

4549 *coeff*: :class:`str` 

4550 Name of coefficient whose uncertainty is being estimated 

4551 *ucoeff*: :class:`str` 

4552 Name of uncertainty coefficient to estimate 

4553 :Required Attributes: 

4554 *FM1.eval_args[coeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4555 List of parameters of which *coeff* is a function 

4556 *FM1.eval_args[ucoeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4557 List of parameters of which *ucoeff* is a function 

4558 *FM1.uq_keys_extra*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`list`) 

4559 List of any extra keys for each uncertainty coeff 

4560 *FM1.uq_keys_shift*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`list`) 

4561 List of keys whose deltas are used to shift *coeff* deltas 

4562 *FM1.uq_funcs_extra*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`function`) 

4563 Function to calculate any "extra" keys by name of key 

4564 *FM1.uq_funcs_shift*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`function`) 

4565 Function to use when "shifting" deltas in *coeff* 

4566 *FM1.uq_keys_extra[ucoeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4567 List of extra coeffs for *ucoeff* {``[]``} 

4568 *FM1.uq_keys_shift[ucoeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4569 List of coeffs to use while shifting *ucoeff* deltas {``[]``} 

4570 *FM1.uq_funcs_extra[ecoeff]*: :class:`function` 

4571 Function to use to estimate extra key *ecoeff* 

4572 *FM1.uq_funcs_shift[ucoeff]*: :class:`function` 

4573 Function to use to shift/alter *ucoeff* deltas 

4574 :Outputs: 

4575 *u*: :class:`float` 

4576 Single uncertainty estimate for generated window 

4577 *U*: :class:`tuple`\ [:class:`float`] 

4578 Value of *ucoeff* and any "extra" coefficients in 

4579 ``FM1.uq_keys_extra[ucoeff]`` 

4580 :Versions: 

4581 * 2019-02-15 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4582 """ 

4583 # --- Inputs --- 

4584 # Probability 

4585 cov = kw.get("Coverage", kw.get("cov", 0.99865)) 

4586 cdf = kw.get("CoverageCDF", kw.get("cdf", cov)) 

4587 # Outlier cutoff 

4588 osig_kw = kw.get('OutlierSigma', kw.get("osig")) 

4589 # --- Attributes --- 

4590 # Unpack useful attributes for additional functions 

4591 uq_funcs_extra = getattr(self, "uq_funcs_extra", {}) 

4592 uq_funcs_shift = getattr(self, "uq_funcs_shift", {}) 

4593 # Additional information 

4594 uq_keys_extra = getattr(self, "uq_keys_extra", {}) 

4595 uq_keys_shift = getattr(self, "uq_keys_shift", {}) 

4596 # Get eval arguments for input coeff and UQ coeff 

4597 argsc = self.eval_args[coeff] 

4598 argsu = self.eval_args[ucoeff] 

4599 # --- Test Conditions --- 

4600 # Get test values and test break points 

4601 vals, bkpts = self._get_test_values(argsc, **kw) 

4602 # --- Evaluation --- 

4603 # Initialize input values for comparison evaluation 

4604 A = tuple() 

4605 # Get dictionary values 

4606 for k in argsc: 

4607 # Get indices 

4608 A += (vals[k][I],) 

4609 # Evaluate both databases 

4610 V1 = self(coeff, *A) 

4611 V2 = FM2(coeff, *A) 

4612 # Deltas 

4613 DV = V2 - V1 

4614 # --- Shift coeffs --- 

4615 # Get extra keys 

4616 cokeys = uq_keys_shift.get(coeff, []) 

4617 # Ensure list 

4618 if cokeys.__class__.__name__ in ["str", "unicode"]: 

4619 # Convert string to singleton 

4620 cokeys = [cokeys] 

4621 # Deltas of co-keys 

4622 DV0_shift = tuple() 

4623 # Loop through shift keys 

4624 for k in cokeys: 

4625 # Evaluate both databases 

4626 V1 = self(k, *A) 

4627 V2 = FM2(k, *A) 

4628 # Append deltas 

4629 DV0_shift += (V2-V1,) 

4630 # --- Outliers --- 

4631 # Degrees of freedom 

4632 df = DV.size 

4633 # Nominal bounds (like 3-sigma for 99.5% coverage, etc.) 

4634 ksig = student.ppf(0.5+0.5*cdf, df) 

4635 kcov = student.ppf(0.5+0.5*cov, df) 

4636 # Outlier cutoff 

4637 if osig_kw is None: 

4638 # Default 

4639 osig = 1.5*ksig 

4640 else: 

4641 # User-supplied value 

4642 osig = osig_kw 

4643 # Check outliers on main deltas 

4644 J = stats.check_outliers(DV, cov, cdf=cdf, osig=osig) 

4645 # Loop through shift keys; points must be non-outlier in all keys 

4646 for DVk in DV0_shift: 

4647 # Check outliers in these deltas 

4648 Jk = stats.check_outliers(DV, cov, cdf=cdf, osig=osig) 

4649 # Combine constraints 

4650 J = np.logical_and(J, Jk) 

4651 # Downselect original deltas 

4652 DV = DV[J] 

4653 # Initialize downselected correlated deltas 

4654 DV_shift = tuple() 

4655 # Downselect correlated deltas 

4656 for DVk in DV0_shift: 

4657 DV_shift += (DVk[J],) 

4658 # New degrees of freedom 

4659 df = DV.size 

4660 # Nominal bounds (like 3-sigma for 99.5% coverage, etc.) 

4661 ksig = student.ppf(0.5+0.5*cdf, df) 

4662 kcov = student.ppf(0.5+0.5*cov, df) 

4663 # Outlier cutoff 

4664 if osig_kw is None: 

4665 # Default 

4666 osig = 1.5*ksig 

4667 else: 

4668 # User-supplied value 

4669 osig = osig_kw 

4670 # --- Extra coeffs --- 

4671 # List of extra keys 

4672 extrakeys = uq_keys_extra.get(ucoeff, []) 

4673 # Ensure list 

4674 if extrakeys.__class__.__name__ in ["str", "unicode"]: 

4675 # Convert string to singleton 

4676 extrakeys = [extrakeys] 

4677 # Initialize tuple of extra key values 

4678 a_extra = tuple() 

4679 # Loop through extra keys 

4680 for k in extrakeys: 

4681 # Get function 

4682 fn = uq_funcs_extra.get(k) 

4683 # This function is required 

4684 if fn is None: 

4685 raise ValueError("No function for extra key '%s'" % k) 

4686 # Evaluate 

4687 a_extra += fn(self, DV, *DV_shift), 

4688 # --- Delta shifting --- 

4689 # Function to perform any shifts 

4690 f_shift = uq_funcs_shift.get(ucoeff) 

4691 # Perform shift 

4692 if f_shift is not None: 

4693 # Extra arguments for shift key 

4694 a_shift = DV_shift + a_extra 

4695 # Perform shift using appropriate function 

4696 DV = f_shift(self, DV, *a_shift) 

4697 # --- Statistics --- 

4698 # Calculate coverage interval 

4699 vmin, vmax = stats.get_cov_interval(DV, cov, cdf=cdf, osig=osig) 

4700 # Max value 

4701 u = max(abs(vmin), abs(vmax)) 

4702 # --- Output --- 

4703 # Return all extra values 

4704 return (u,) + a_extra 

4705 

4706 # Single-point UQ estimate 

4707 def EstimateUQ_point(self, FM2, coeff, ucoeff, *a, **kw): 

4708 """Quantify uncertainty interval for a single point or window 

4709 

4710 :Call: 

4711 >>> u, = FM1.EstimateUQ_point(FM2, coeff, ucoeff, *a, **kw) 

4712 >>> U = FM1.EstimateUQ_point(FM2, coeff, ucoeff, *a, **kw) 

4713 :Inputs: 

4714 *FM1*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4715 Original coefficient database 

4716 *FM2*: :class:`DBCoeff` 

4717 Comparison coefficient database 

4718 *coeff*: :class:`str` 

4719 Name of coefficient whose uncertainty is being estimated 

4720 *ucoeff*: :class:`str` 

4721 Name of uncertainty coefficient 

4722 *a*: :class:`tuple`\ [:class:`float`] 

4723 Conditions at which to evaluate uncertainty 

4724 *a[0]*: :class:`float` 

4725 Value of *FM1.eval_args[ucoeff][0]* 

4726 :Keyword Arguments: 

4727 *nmin*: {``30``} | :class:`int` > 0 

4728 Minimum number of points in window 

4729 *cov*, *Coverage*: {``0.99865``} | 0 < :class:`float` < 1 

4730 Fraction of data that must be covered by UQ term 

4731 *cdf*, *CoverageCDF*: {*cov*} | 0 < :class:`float` < 1 

4732 Coverage fraction assuming perfect distribution 

4733 *test_values*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

4734 Candidate values of each *eval_arg* for comparison 

4735 *test_bkpts*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`np.ndarray`) 

4736 Candidate break points (1D unique values) for *eval_args* 

4737 :Required Attributes: 

4738 *FM1.eval_args[coeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4739 List of parameters of which *coeff* is a function 

4740 *FM1.eval_args[ucoeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4741 List of parameters of which *ucoeff* is a function 

4742 *FM1.uq_keys_extra*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`list`) 

4743 List of any extra keys for each uncertainty coeff 

4744 *FM1.uq_keys_shift*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`list`) 

4745 List of keys whose deltas are used to shift *coeff* deltas 

4746 *FM1.uq_funcs_extra*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`function`) 

4747 Function to calculate any "extra" keys by name of key 

4748 *FM1.uq_funcs_shift*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` (:class:`function`) 

4749 Function to use when "shifting" deltas in *coeff* 

4750 *FM1.uq_keys_extra[ucoeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4751 List of extra coeffs for *ucoeff* {``[]``} 

4752 *FM1.uq_keys_shift[ucoeff]*: :class:`list` (:class:`str`) 

4753 List of coeffs to use while shifting *ucoeff* deltas {``[]``} 

4754 *FM1.uq_funcs_extra[ecoeff]*: :class:`function` 

4755 Function to use to estimate extra key *ecoeff* 

4756 *FM1.uq_funcs_shift[ucoeff]*: :class:`function` 

4757 Function to use to shift/alter *ucoeff* deltas 

4758 :Outputs: 

4759 *u*: :class:`float` 

4760 Single uncertainty estimate for generated window 

4761 *U*: :class:`tuple`\ [:class:`float`] 

4762 Value of *ucoeff* and any "extra" coefficients in 

4763 ``FM1.uq_keys_extra[ucoeff]`` 

4764 :Versions: 

4765 * 2019-02-15 ``@ddalle``: First version 

4766 """ 

4767 # --- Inputs --- 

4768 # Get eval arguments for input coeff and UQ coeff 

4769 argsu = self.eval_args[ucoeff] 

4770 # Get minimum number of points in statistical window 

4771 nmin = kw.get("nmin", 30) 

4772 # --- Windowing --- 

4773 # Get window 

4774 I = self.GetWindow(nmin, argsu, *a, **kw) 

4775 # --- Evaluation --- 

4776 # Call stand-alone method 

4777 U = self._estimate_UQ_point(FM2, coeff, ucoeff, I, **kw) 

4778 # --- Output --- 

4779 return U
